Authors: Putri N.K.S., Rahman A., Qing C.H.G., Djojo B.W.
Title: Knowledge management systems in construction consulting company
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Departement, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Putri, N.K.S., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Departement, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Rahman, A., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Departement, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Qing, C.H.G., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Departement, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Djojo, B.W., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Departement, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: As a construction consulting company, knowledge management is a crucial asset required to be competitively advantageous in the industry. It is not commonly practiced systematically, particularly in state owned companies. Hence, the purpose of this research is to develop a web-based knowledge management system design based on the path analysis results and TAM model to support state owned companies. The path analysis aims to determine the extent of the employee's intention to support knowledge management system creation. The data will be collected from 63 respondent questionnaire, interviews and observation in the construction consulting company. The research results revealed the significance between attitude toward computer and organizational culture toward the intentions of employees using knowledge management systems. Therefore, the knowledge management system design is recommended to apply in the company with the suggestive KMS features. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Knowledge management system; OOAD; Path analysis; State owned companies; TAM
Index Keywords: Behavioral research; Human resource management; Knowledge based systems; Regression analysis; Surveys; Systems analysis; Consulting companies; Knowledge management system; Organizational cultures; Path analysis; Research results; State-owned companies; Support knowledge; Web based; Knowledge management

Title: Oil Gas Industry Mapping Analysis with GIS Approach: A Literature Review
Source title: 2019 7th International Conference on Cyber and IT Service Management, CITSM 2019
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Qing, C.H.G., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Heripracoyo, S., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: As the millennial era strikes in, smart industries or known as industry 4.0 is a wide spoken topic in the world of industries. By the concerns of Indonesia upon several arise issues, this paper present a pre-study of the Geographical Information System (GIS) approaches to dwell in the Industrial sector specified in the Oil Gas Industry. As industry 4.0 constitutes a new operations system, adjustments and new mindset are integrated to enhance the industry process. Pertamina Hulu Mahakam had collaborated with GIS to improve its technological processes and monitoring activities. By using a gap analysis and systematic literature review, the results will illustrate the mapping analysis protruding the data integration and ownerships which has been the concern of the government in Indonesia. Using ArcGIS online, the tools ease the visualization and creation of the proposed map design to show an efficient mapping of the oil gas industries. Accordingly, some current issues, challenges, and proposed solutions are mentioned and limitations mentioned are recommended for peer further research purposes. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Geographical Information System; Industry 4.0; map design; Oil gas industry
Index Keywords: Data integration; Gas industry; Industry 4.0; Information systems; Information use; Mapping; Maps; Industrial sector; Literature reviews; Map design; Mapping analysis; Monitoring activities; Research purpose; Systematic literature review; Technological process; Geographic information systems

Authors: Sukarman H., Putri N.K.S., Qing C.H.G.
Title: Green information technology government regulation components: Improving Indonesia green information technology
Source title: Journal of Theoretical and Applied Information Technology
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sukarman, H., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Putri, N.K.S., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Qing, C.H.G., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Information and communication technology (ICT) becomes one of the key drivers of economic growth and competitiveness. In contrary, the increasing of the ICT usage is not followed by the increasing of the green ICT awareness and behavior. Our previous research on Private higher education institution practice of green information technology governance model had resulted some obstruction on the implementation. One of the most crucial aspect among others is the government policies and regulations deficiencies. Hence, this study describes as well as proposes green IT government regulation components which can be regulated by Indonesia’s government. 6(six) green IT government regulation components (green knowledge, regulatory design, regulation dimensions, directive cost, awareness and innovation/technology) were categorized based on literature review. © 2005 – ongoing JATIT & LLS

Authors: Qing C.H.G., Oktaviani E., Heripracoyo S.
Title: The Literature Review of Manufacturing Industry 4.0 Using Mapping Design with GIS Approach
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Qing, C.H.G., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Oktaviani, E., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Heripracoyo, S., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this literature review is to identify the importance Geographical Information System (GIS) and Industrial 4.0 roles in enhancing manufacturing industry in near future. As the industrial 4.0 concepts has revolved and visible components have surfaced, this paper will use a systematic literature review methodology to assert the crucial elements of manufacturing industries in GIS and Industrial 4.0 concepts for providing a resolution in improving manufacturing industries. In addition, Arcgis online would be used to create a visualization of the proposed map design that shows the potentiality to solve current concerns of manufacturing industries in Bekasi. Along with the evolution of industrial 4.0, it is crucial to grasp on the idea on how to wisely integrate GIS and manufacturing industry location data in-order to track industries sites and monitor activity data ubiquitously. We conclude the analytical elements supported by the evidence and also a proposed map design which could aid the complex decision making and site location tracking of manufacturing industries in Indonesia. By doing this research, the motivation is to convince GIS contribution to manufacturing industry evolution, there are more reasons and evidence to implement GIS to adapt to the current developing industrial 4.0. For further research purposes, this prestudy is the initiation of manufacturing future foresight. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: bekasi; geographical information system; Indonesia; industry 4.0; manufacturing industry; map design
Index Keywords: Decision making; Geographic information systems; Industry 4.0; Information management; Information systems; Information use; Maps; bekasi; Complex decision; Indonesia; Literature reviews; Manufacturing industries; Map design; Research purpose; Systematic literature review; Industrial research

Authors: Putri N.K.S., Qing C.H.G., Kuncoro E.A., Goenadi E.
Title: Evaluation of Knowledge Management System Using House of Quality Method in Private Banking Industry
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Business Information Technology Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Putri, N.K.S., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Qing, C.H.G., Business Information Technology Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kuncoro, E.A., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Goenadi, E., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this paper is to describe the evaluation of knowledge management system (KMS) using House of Quality Method for several branches of private banking industry in Indonesia. The high-level house of quality matrix was modified and used as a tool to evaluate the ongoing KMS implementation. Additionally, the Infosys KM Maturity Model was applied to determine its maturity level. Targeted result for this study is to form a recommendation for KMS implementation in the organization, especially in the private banking industry. KMS spread to various business field. It becomes an obligation for every organization to manage its knowledge flow and drive it to achieve innovation. As an industry with huge amount of knowledge come in and out daily, banking industry need to take their KMS to another level. By evaluating its KMS periodically, organization may improve the performance, quality and maturity level of its KMS. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: HoQ; house of quality; KMS; knowledge management system; private banking industry
Index Keywords: Houses; Knowledge based systems; Knowledge management; Banking industry; Evaluation of knowledge; House of Quality; Indonesia; Knowledge flow; Knowledge management system; Maturity levels; Maturity model; Quality control
